abstracts.cdata!:
The Highlands Water Engineering Project
            in Lesotho was successful. The project achieved all its
            objectives, within time end cost and its institutional
            development success is noteworthy. The effective and
            successful implementation of the environmental action plan
            will have positive impacts on the physical and social
            environment and the living conditions for residents in the
            Lesotho Highlands Water Project (LHWP) area. In addition,
            the project funded the Lesotho Electricity Corporation (LEC)
            development planning and tariff study which provided the
            necessary information for improving the management,
            operation and financial performance of LEC. The main lessons
            drawn from the implementation of the Lesotho Highlands Water
            Engineering Project are: Careful monitoring, close
            coordination in the implementation of various components,
            and adherence to the implementation schedule at the early
            stage are crucial for the timely completion of the project.
            Attracting staff to the project implementing agency, care
            should be taken not to cause a drain of skilled local staff
            from other government agencies; early focus, open
            information sharing, and debate are essential for ensuring
            the agreement by all parties on a comprehensive
            environmental action plan.
